headline: Bitcoin Slides To 6-Month Low Amid Hawkish Fed Turn
summary: The bitcoin price continued its sharp fall for a second day, hitting a six-month low early Friday but coming off its lows.  The fall in the cryptocurrency and stocks such as Strategy and Coinbase Global comes as markets react to a hawkish shift in Federal Reserve policymaker comments raising doubt about an interest-rate cut next month, despite labor market softness.  Bitcoin's sell-off appears to have added another worry for stock market investors amid concern that financial engineering had begun to propel the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, including Magnificent Seven stocks like Nvidia.

Bitcoin's sell-off appears to have added another worry for stock market investors amid concern that financial engineering had begun to propel the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, including Magnificent Seven stocks like Nvidia.

headline: Bitcoin Price Drops Further Below $100,000
summary: The cryptocurrency selloff continues.    Bitcoin recently traded at a little over $95,500.   Earlier in the session it traded as low as $94,519—the lowest intraday level since May 7, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Coinbase Slams Banks for Trying to Ban Stablecoin Rewards
summary: Coinbase has mounted a fierce defense of stablecoin reward programs, accusing banking associations of attempting to expand Congress’s interest prohibition beyond its statutory limits illegally.The crypto exchange’s pushback targets efforts by bank lobbyists to classify merchant discounts and third-party benefits as prohibited “indirect interest” under the GENIUS Act.Chief Policy Officer ...

headline: Coinbase on what Wall Street investors will do next in crypto
summary: In this episode of Yahoo Finance Future Focus, our host Brian McGleenon chats to Coinbase’s head of institutional, Brett Tejpaul, to discuss how Wall Street’s relationship with crypto is evolving. Tejpaul explains why a second wave of major investors is now entering the digital asset space, driven by clearer US regulation, the legalisation of stablecoins, and growing confidence in blockchain’s utility. He also shares insights on how pension funds, corporations, and global financial firms are approaching crypto exposure, and why this new wave of adoption could transform markets worldwide.
